name: Club Med Kani

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent our honeymoon on this amazing island and stayed in one of the over-water bungalows. Shortly before leaving we read on here that there are bungalows with good views and some that overlook one another. After requesting a room with uninterrupted sunset ocean views we found ourselves in one of the best bungalows.
reviews.title: Our dream honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms themselves are very spacious for two people and the housekeeping staff led by the always smiling and friendly Sobah keep your room clean and your linen fresh. On arrival at our room we had a bottle of champagne and fresh fruit waiting for us. Every few days we would be greeted back at our room by one of many towel animals the staff had folded or a full bubble bath with rose petals in it to make the stay that bit more special.
reviews.title: Excelent option for surfers and babymooners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 5 trident space is an area that we both loved. It was a very inviting space where you could go and relax, use wi-fi, meet other guests or have a drink from the open bar of premium spirits served by the happy and generous Bandara. If there is anything they didn't have we just had to ask and they would get it for us.
reviews.title: Most memorable holiday, If its Maldives, it has to be CLUBMED!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: There was never a lack of things to do on this island. It has a basic gym to work off all the delicious food, plenty of water sports including sailing, jet skis, scuba and snorkeling tours with or our favourite, snorkeling off our private jetty.. The pool was much needed as it could get quite hot but if you wanted to get a tad hotter in the pool the water aerobics with Singh was fun.. Followed by the daily Club Med pool dance taken by the hilarious Naufal.
reviews.title: Great for relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When it came to meal time there was never a shortage of delicious food at the buffet. There was Italian food, Japanese, Chinese, Carvery, Cheese, Cold meats and deserts. All the food is cooked to perfection and the waiting staff are always there to show you to your table or get you a beer.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Yamaha powered diesel engine Club Med boat propelled from Male to Kani we passed by small islands & kept on watching blue shades of waters. I was in moment of surrender to the serene beauty of Kani island as boat anchored itself on shores of Club Med Kani village. We checked in our beach villa which had straight access to beach ( villa was exceptionally spacious & with all complimentary refreshments so i'll give 10/10 for that) Room service is prompt & friendly. This is the first time we traveled in Club med village and the concept of hospitality is quiet different then other 5-star properties. The staff is turbo charged to entertain us & help us out on any advise or suggestion ( among staff star performers were Andy, Kiki, Mr Singh, Brazilian salsa girl ( outstanding performance in Brazilian night) and none I other then village chief 'Daniel" whose attitude towards guests is extremely warm, respectful & helpful. In short he gives a dash of personal touch to all guest members. We checked in Lagoon suite for 2 nights ( amazing experience once again) I would advise tripadvisor members to take up 4 nights, which ideally best way to experience Maldives. I wish GO members excellent tenure in Club Med & keep up the turbo power to make the kani village most desired destination for beach lovers....Ciao Merci mille fois, Mille fois merci !!!!!
reviews.title: Pearl of Indian ocean ......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the best vacation we had so far. The GO/GE is great. Special thanks to Jerol for taking care of us during our stay in the Lagoon Suites room 160 . Room are clean and view is good. Lots of privacy.
reviews.title: "Best place to be"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love the cocktail party that thrown in too where we get to know many great friends from all over the world. Food is great!. We also did something that not many travellers will do which we bought a lots of T-shirt from the boutique. Thanks to Shadeed, Gwen, Masoka for serving us so well. They really have good sense on fashion and give me good advise what is good on me. I ended buying stuff 3days straight.. Buffet is simple food and tasted good .. we adapt to the food after 2nd day and started to enjoy it very much and we luv the hospitality given by the GE ..Ali/Shazim and of course chef John. Cooking lesson is something i didnt expect for and I enjoyed it very much. Hubby went for snorkelling 2x a day for straight 3 days. He loves it and best thing is each time the excursion is at different spots. That makes it more interesting and looking forward each day. We also love the sunset bar, the band that serenade nice songs and she sang so well... at the pool initially i taught those music is from music machine not knowing it is someone singing it live at the bar!...great voice and really enjoyed it. At the Iru Bar...Andy is such a talented person and nice getting to know him too. Love the line dance/zumba dance with Andy, Singh and the rest of the GO. Great team that makes our holidays such a memorable one. We really enjoyed the trip and it is very relaxing especially when you stay at the lagoon suites.My hubby will be taking his diving lesson and i will be taking swimming lesson (yes i cant swim) and we will be back!.
reviews.title: Memorable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The stay at Club Med was memorable and great! The Hotel Staff are one of the best I have seen and take genuine interest in ensuring that guests have a comfortable stay. They get to know you at a personal level and one evening act was also dedicated to us!
reviews.title: Just alright

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The persponalized service and attention to detail is peerless. Highly recommend this to people planning to visit Maldives! The facilties are great , villas very neat and comfortable and experience fantastic. The diving etam was very helpful too.
reviews.title: Paradise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week in a water bungalow, zone 5T. The bungalows are very spacious, clean and luxureous. You have a mini bar, nespresso machine and breakfast in the room in complementary. You have your own terrace a step to the lagoon, life jackets are in the room. Next to champagne and delicious appetizeres in your own lounge you can enjoy all the facilities of the club (zone 4T) on the island. Food is excellent with a broad choice: italian, continential, indian, chinese and japanese. House wine is complementary but for a normal prize (30 Eu) you can get a nice bottle (pinot grigio...). The atmosphere is very relax, the GO very nice. Shows were good (we loved the diva show), crazy signs energetic. Club med is always a little like being at home (comfortable and cosy). We planned this holiday for our 20th wedding anniversary and enjoyed every minute of it. Thanks to Kiki, Miranda, Stephen, Kannie and many more for again making this an unforgattible trip. Just don't forget your mosquito stick at home!
reviews.title: heaven does exist

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: Totally cool. However food could be better especially at the Kanda restaurant. Remember to bring along a tube of insect repellent & mosquito cream/balm. I was bitten quite a bit on the leg as I was wearing shorts quite often. It was really itchy, keeping me awake at night. The hospitality is superb.
reviews.title: It is a Paradise, an unforgettable place for the die hard romantics.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have many opinions for Club Med Maldives. Firstly, All staffs are excellent in service mind. Now we miss one Japanese staff - Aya. Here located in good location. All rooms are very close the sea.
reviews.title: Good Service Mind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think the best room in Lagoon suite is the room number 123, it's in the best view point. But anyway there're somethings I don't like, the first, an extra bed is too small...it's very bad. Another one is all food are distasteful (I think especially for Thai people).
reviews.title: Awesome trip to piece of heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My suggestion is you should prepare some electronic cars for using as transportation in your hotel because we have to walk very far from the room to the lobby.
reviews.title: Perfect for resting and relaxing, even with children

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We booked a 4 night stay at the Lagoon Suite. Arriving late night in the middle of rain :(, a really long walk to our end of the jetty suite in the dark and under the rain and strong wind it felt quite miserable. Until we entered our Private Paradise... The Suite was so romantic, cosy and TO DIE FOR!
reviews.title: Miss U Kani...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning it was still raining but I loved the refreshing wind that came with it, as long as we were not walking with the umbrella battling the wind force! We spent that day lounging in the various bars and back in our room. The main bar was very cosy. Shutters were down to avoid the rain but it wasn't stuffy with great sea breeze. We then went back to the Manta Bar, exclusive for the Lagoon Suite guests. Unfortunately, the first half of the stay their air conditioning was out of order. Thus, it was a bit warm. During that time, due to the rain, we couldn't lounge outside at their cosy day beds.
reviews.title: 100% Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: There were loads to occupy your time though throughout the resort. Aside from the bottomless food and booze, there were board games (even in our room), card and mahjong sets and tables, ping pong, etc... The infinity pool was a cool respite from the heat (once the sky cleared up) albeit a bit small and boring, being a dull rectangular shape.
reviews.title: So much to talk about

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The sky cleared up on the second day and we managed to go for the afternoon snorkeling. Not too bad but visibility wasn't the best due to the weather. We did morning snorkeling the next day at another location. Much better and well worth the effort. Do try to do it at least once a day. The equipments were very new and clean.
reviews.title: Excellent Place for Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Being in the Lagoon Suite, we could swim off our private jetty. However, there was nothing exciting around at all. Just sand and a little bit of rocks and sea grass. I regretted lugging my snorkeling gears all the way from home since I read that snorkeling gears are not provided except for the scheduled snorkeling trips and I thought I would do some snorkeling directly from my room. Nearer to the Manta Bar you do spot baby sharks, rays and other fish. Look out for crabs once the night falls!
reviews.title: almost perfect

aka: Club Med Kani Hotel North Male Atoll
